item.title: Nuremberg (2025) Film Review
item.description:
üìò Plot Summary

The film focuses on the true story of the psychological duel between US Army psychiatrist Douglas Kelley (Rami Malek) and the imprisoned Nazi leader Hermann G√∂ring (Russell Crowe) during the first Nuremberg trial in 1945-1946. As the Allies attempt to hold the Nazi regime accountable for the Holocaust, Kelley works to understand the depths of their evil.

Despite arriving late and missing the first five or so minutes (or, let‚Äôs be honest, maybe twenty üòÖ), Nuremberg still pulled me straight into its world and held my attention all the way through its long, deliberate runtime.

For a...

item.title: Peter Hook and the Light Holmfirth Picturedrome
item.description:
Peter Hook and The Light ‚Äì Picturedrome, Holmfirth ‚Äì Thursday, November 20th

Thursday night at the Picturedrome in Holmfirth was a bittersweet celebration of post-punk classics as Peter Hook and The Light delivered a spellbinding performance. The crowd, buzzing with excitement, filled the intimate venue with energy from the moment Hooky and the band took the stage. Fans old and new swayed and sang along to every note, creating an electric and communal atmosphere.

The setlist was a masterclass in nostalgia, opening with the punchy ‚ÄúGet Ready‚Äù followed by ‚ÄúCrystal‚Äù (New Order cover) and ‚Äú60 Miles an Hour‚Äù, immediately...

item.title: CRASH Live 2025 A Retro Gaming Weekend in Warwickshire
item.description:
The CRASH Live 2025 event took place on the 15th and 16th November 2025, hosted at the Holiday Inn in Kenilworth, Warwickshire and what a weekend it turned out to be.

Battling the Storms to Get There

The journey down was not for the faint-hearted.
After a night of relentless storms, flooded roads, and detours that felt like bonus levels from a lost 8-bit adventure game, getting to the venue became an achievement in itself. But arriving at the hotel, greeted by fellow retro enthusiasts, made the effort instantly worthwhile.

ZX Spectrum Next & Gremlin Graphics Sessions

...

item.title: Building My Own Blog Site with Jekyll
item.description:
Why I Chose Jekyll for My Blog

Creating your own blog gives you full control over content, design, and performance. I wanted a platform that:

  • Is lightweight and fast ‚úÖ
  • Supports Markdown content naturally üìÑ
  • Allows full customization without relying on WordPress or hosted platforms üé®
  • Integrates easily with GitHub Pages for free hosting üåê
  • Can showcase my interests: film, tech, hiking, sport, and music üé¨üöÄüèûÔ∏è‚öΩüéµ

Jekyll is perfect because it‚Äôs a static site generator that converts Markdown posts into a fast, responsive website. Paired with the Jekflix theme, I can create a cinematic, modern design tailored...

item.title: Skiddaw Summit via Jenkins Bridleway
item.description:
Hiking to Skiddaw Summit & Little Man

Overview

Parking isnt great and you need to arrive early to have any chance of a parking space (the car park is small). Otherwise this was a fantastic hike with great views. We even managed to experience a cloud inversion.

After some early clag this cleared and its a pretty steep and brutal ascent. We took in Skiddaw little man also and recommend you tackle this afer summitting.

Key Hike Points

  • Steep but rewarding ascent
  • Cloud inversion at the summit
  • Claggy start
  • Limited parking (arrive early)

Quote from...

item.title: Creating a Reusable Hike Info Box in Jekyll
item.description:
Introduction

In this post, I‚Äôll explain how I created a reusable Hike Info Box for my hiking posts using Jekyll and the Jekflix theme. The system is modular and can be adapted to any category, whether hiking, tech tutorials, recipes, or music albums.

The main goals:

  1. Store metadata in the front-matter.
  2. Render a visually appealing info box with icons, animations, and badges.
  3. Only display the box for relevant posts.
  4. Make it easy to reuse for future posts.

Step 1: Add Metadata to Post Front-Matter

Jekyll posts allow custom variables in the YAML front-matter. For...

item.title: What's the difference between Observability & Monitoring?
item.description:
Introduction

I often get asked what is the difference between observability and monitoring and should observability replace monitoring? Lets take it back to the premise of what traditional monitoring is. This is my first article in my Site Reliability Engineering series.

I have been involved in monitoring over 20 years and the design, architecture and implementation of a whole range of monitoring tools across both open source and enterprise.

Monitoring is about the known knowns and traditionally this would involve the templating up of these scenarios and coding them into the monitoring stack for infrastructure...

item.title: Beginners Guide to building in GCP with Terraform
item.description:
Goal

This article will set out what you need in order to be able to standup an automated build of a VM (Google Cloud) a web server (Apache) and Ansible.

What will we cover

Deployment of a Google Compute VM instance using Terraform Use of a Compute Instance startup script or user-data Rendering a Terraform template Dependencies

You have created a GCP account (or trial account). You will receive $300 of credits and also 750 hours per month will be free if you select the e2-micro instance. More information can be found in the tutorial below including the...
